intro: Hedyotis pterospora, commonly known as the slender knotweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including China, India, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Hedyotis pterospora is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
